item.title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale begins on January 13, Prime members to get 12-hour early access - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amazon Great Republic Day Sale Begins on January 13, Prime Members to Get 12-Hour Early Access

Publication Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Amazon Great Republic Day Sale is set to commence on January 13, providing Prime members with an exclusive 12-hour early access to amazing discounts across various categories.

  • Deals on washing machines, saving up to 65%.
  • Smart TVs available at discounts up to 65%.
  • Refrigerators discounted by up to 65%.
  • Excellent promotions on laptops catering to various needs.
  • Significant bank offers for additional savings.
“The Amazon Great Republic Day Sale ensures significant savings for every shopper.”

This upcoming sale promises an extensive range of discounted items, making it a great opportunity to snag some incredible deals.

item.title: Sensex crashes over 600 points: What's behind the fall in Indian stock market & how to trade now? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Sensex Crashes Over 600 Points: What’s Behind the Fall in Indian Stock Market & How to Trade Now?

Date: January 8, 2024   Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market faced a significant downturn today, with the Sensex crashing over 700 points amid global weakness and increased selling pressure from foreign investors. The Nifty 50 also recorded a notable decline.

The following key factors have contributed to the market's drop:

  • Weak global cues affecting domestic sentiment.
  • Waning hopes for a US Federal Reserve rate cut.
  • Caution ahead of expected Q3 earnings season.
  • Poor performance from major IT and banking stocks.
  • Sustained foreign capital outflows impacting market stability.
"The trend of strong US macros weakening emerging markets is continuing." - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services

Investors are encouraged to consider a long-term perspective, targeting large-cap stocks in financials and pharmaceuticals as potential recovery plays.

item.title: Why are shares of Dixon Technologies, CG Power and peers witnessing a sharp fall? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Why are shares of Dixon Technologies, CG Power and peers witnessing a sharp fall?

Date: January 8, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The stocks of Dixon Technologies and other Electronic Manufacturing Companies have experienced sharp declines, leading to a loss of up to 8% in daily trading. This follows Tata Group's announcement of a $18 billion investment in electronics and semiconductor production.

  • Dixon Technologies sees an 8% drop in share price.
  • Other companies such as Kaynes Tech and CG Power also report losses of 4% to 8%.
  • The Tata Group's planned $18 billion investment aims to open nine new factories over two years.
  • Nomura recently labeled Dixon a top pick in the EMS sector, with a target price of ₹22,256.
  • A significant increase in mobile exports is projected, benefiting Dixon Technologies.
“Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran called this field a 'long game'.”

The recent downturn in shares contrasts sharply with the substantial gains these companies made over the past year.

item.title: Kalyan Jewellers share price slumps 6% on profit booking post Q3 update; Should you buy or sell? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Kalyan Jewellers Share Price Slumps 6% on Profit Booking Post Q3 Update

Date: January 8, 2025 Source: Live Mint

Kalyan Jewellers shares fell by 6.2% after a Q3 update indicated significant revenue growth driven by festive demand.

  • The stock dropped to ₹677.55 following investor profit booking.
  • Q3 revenue grew nearly 41% year-on-year, with a same-store sales increase of 24%.
  • The company launched 24 new showrooms in India during the quarter.
  • Revenue from the Middle East increased by approximately 22% compared to the previous year.
  • Kalyan's digital brand, Candere, saw an 89% revenue growth and opened 23 new showrooms.
  • The firm inaugurated its first COCO showroom in the U.S.
  • Motilal Oswal issued a 'buy' rating for Kalyan Jewellers stock with a target price of ₹850.
“The stock is in strong uptrend and forming higher lows on monthly scale from last few months,” Motilal Oswal reported.

This downward movement in share price comes despite robust overall business performance, leaving investors considering future actions.

item.title: Microsoft inks strategic partnerships to make India’s core sectors AI-first - Microsoft
item.description:
Microsoft inks strategic partnerships to make India’s core sectors AI-first

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Source India

Microsoft has announced several strategic partnerships with key sectors in India to enhance cloud and AI initiatives, aiming to build a robust AI ecosystem in the country.

  • Microsoft has formed alliances with RailTel, Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Finserv, Mahindra Group, and upGrad to advance AI adoption in their operations.
  • The company signed an MoU with India AI to support AI innovation, establish AI Centers of Excellence, and promote inclusive growth.
“The world is looking to India’s leadership in AI, and our partners are helping the country move forward with AI.” - Puneet Chandok, Microsoft India

Microsoft is committed to investing $3 billion in AI and cloud infrastructure in India, fostering innovation across various sectors.

item.title: RIL, Kalyan Jewellers, MMTC, Spandana Sphoorty, Paytm, Dixon Technologies, KEC International: Check top buzzing stocks of the day - Upstox
item.description:
Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: RIL, Kalyan Jewellers, and More

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Upstox

Domestic shares were generally in negative territory in the afternoon deals, with significant movement among various stocks.

  • Kalyan Jewellers: Shares dropped 7.5% despite a 39% revenue growth in Q3.
  • Reliance Industries (RIL): The stock rose nearly 2% with analysts predicting up to 36% upside.
  • Dixon Technologies: Stock fell 7.8% but remains up 171% over the past year.
  • Zomato: Shares declined 2.73% amid competition concerns.
  • Ola Electric Mobility: Stock dropped over 5% after receiving a SEBI warning.
  • Tata Technologies: Shares rose 3.4% after a new partnership announcement.
  • Dr Reddy's: Stock climbed 3.99% following a subsidiary's sale announcement.
  • ONGC: Shares up over 2% as crude oil prices rise.
  • MMTC: Stock trading over 12% higher.
  • Spandana Sphoorty: Stock rose over 14%, showcasing positive performance in microfinance.
  • Paytm: Shares dropped 5.75% following the sale of a stake in PayPay Corporation.
  • KEC International: Stock was down 6.81% post-initial gains from securing new orders.

item.title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 Announced: Check Expected Deals On Smartphones, Exchange Offers, And Bank Discounts - Zee News
item.description:
Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 Announced: Check Expected Deals On Smartphones, Exchange Offers, And Bank Discounts

Date: January 13, 2025 - Source: Zee News

The Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025 is set to begin on January 13 at 12 PM, offering shoppers exciting discounts and exchange offers on a wide range of products.

Key Points:

  • The sale kicks off with early access at midnight on January 13.
  • Exchange offers include up to Rs 45,000 off on smartphones and discounts on other electronics.
  • Bank offers include a 10% discount for SBI Credit Card users and 5% cashback for ICICI Amazon Pay Credit Card users.
  • Major smartphone brands like OnePlus, Motorola, and Samsung are expected to feature heavily in the sale.
"Consumers can avail of exchange discounts of up to Rs 45,000 on smartphones, Rs 7,000 on laptops, and Rs 15,000 on home appliances."

In conclusion, the Amazon Great Republic Day Sale promises significant savings for consumers looking to upgrade their gadgets and enjoy various deals.

item.title: Sam Altman reacts to his sister’s allegations of financial, sexual abuse; “untrue”, says OpenAI CEO - The Hindu
item.description:
Sam Altman reacts to his sister’s allegations of financial, sexual abuse; “untrue”, says OpenAI CEO

Published: January 08, 2025 12:37 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has denied allegations of sexual abuse made by his sister, labeling them as “untrue” and attributing her claims to mental health challenges.

  • Altman responded to a lawsuit filed by his sister alleging sexual abuse that began when she was three years old.
  • He emphasized the emotional toll on their family due to these allegations.
  • Altman claimed that the family has financially and medically supported his sister, who has publicly accused them multiple times before.
  • Amidst these claims, he mentioned that she has made various accusations against family members regarding money and privacy issues.
“All of these claims are utterly untrue,” said Altman. “This situation causes immense pain to our entire family.”

Altman reiterated that the accusations had evolved over time, intensifying with the recent lawsuit filed against him.

item.title: Top Cement Stock Picks: These shares offer upside of up to 30%, as per CLSA - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top Cement Stock Picks: These shares offer upside of up to 30%, as per CLSA

Publication Date: January 8, 2025
Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm CLSA has turned constructive on the cement sector as earnings visibility improves and opportunities arise for companies.

  • CLSA forecasts a demand recovery in the cement sector.
  • Consolidation and capacity expansion are expected to continue.
  • Profitability is aided by low base and cost savings.
  • Significant upgrades and price target changes for leading cement stocks.
“CLSA has upgraded ACC and Dalmia Bharat to 'outperform'. Ambuja Cements holds a potential upside of 19%.”

This renewed optimism in the cement sector suggests a positive outlook for investors, with potential upsides in multiple stocks.

item.title: Explained — Why Spandana Sphoorty, CreditAccess Grameen shares surged up to 16% - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Explained — Why Spandana Sphoorty, CreditAccess Grameen shares surged up to 16%

Publication Date: January 8, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of Spandana Sphoorty and CreditAccess Grameen have surged significantly, with Spandana experiencing a gain of 35% in the last two trading sessions and CreditAccess snapping a three-day losing streak.

  • Spandana Sphoorty shares have gained up to 35% recently.
  • CreditAccess Grameen shares have increased by 11% to 15% as of January 8.
  • The Department of Financial Services is hosting consultative meetings for the industry between January 7 to January 16.
  • Key players discuss easing repayment schedules and enhancing borrowing rates.
  • Analyst Sushil Kedia predicts Spandana's stock could reach ₹1,800.
  • Current trading prices: Spandana at ₹453.7 and CreditAccess at ₹995.7.
Sushil Kedia stated, "The stock may surge to levels of ₹1,800, which is a return of nearly 6x from Monday's closing levels."

The recent surge in share prices reflects investor optimism amid upcoming discussions on industry challenges and potential regulatory support.

item.title: Zomato enters 15 minutes delivery battle, app shows new tab for customers | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Zomato Launches 15-Minute Delivery Option in App

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Zomato has introduced a new '15 minutes delivery' option in its app, allowing customers to see food options that can be delivered quickly from restaurants within a 1.5 km radius of their location, further intensifying the competition in quick delivery services.

  • Zomato's app now features a '15 mins delivery' tab in the Explore section.
  • The delivery option is currently limited to restaurants within a 1.5 km distance.
  • This move follows Swiggy's launch of a 10-minute delivery service called 'Bolt'.
  • Zomato's previous attempt at a quick delivery service, Zomato Instant, came amid customer backlash in 2022.
“Will be for specific nearby locations, popular and standardised items only.” - Deepinder Goyal, CEO of Zomato

The launch of Zomato's 15-minute delivery service indicates a competitive thrust into the quick delivery segment, possibly leading to a revised approach to their earlier quick-service initiatives.

item.title: Here is why Reliance Industries share price has a potential upside of 36% - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Here is why Reliance Industries share price has a potential upside of 36%

Publication Date: January 8, 2024 | Source: CNBCTV18

Brokerage firm Jefferies has reviewed Reliance Industries Ltd’s share price and indicates a potential upside of 36%, reiterating its 'buy' recommendation.

  • Jefferies sets a price target of ₹1,690, indicating a 36% upside from Tuesday's closing price.
  • Reliance Industries recently underperformed the Nifty 50 index by 15% in 2024.
  • Concerns over growth prospects in the retail sector and lower earnings growth impacted share performance.
  • Growth restoration in the retail business and profit improvements in the Oil-To-Chemicals sector are expected by FY2026.
  • Reliance's current valuations are the cheapest since March 2020.
  • Bernstein also projects a recovery cycle in 2025, targeting ₹1,520 per share for Reliance Industries.
  • Out of 39 analysts, 33 recommend 'buy', with the highest target being ₹1,950.
“Risk-reward for the stock is attractive as valuations are at a three-year low.” - Bernstein

The overall market sentiment indicates optimism for Reliance Industries as it trades at ₹1,263, showing a modest gain.

item.title: RBI Guv Malhotra faces calls to unshackle rupee amid surging dollar - Business Standard
item.description:
Calls for RBI Governor Malhotra to Allow Rupee Flexibility Amid Dollar Surge

Date: Unknown | Source: Unknown

The new Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, Sanjay Malhotra, faces pressure to change the current exchange rate policy favored by his predecessor amidst a strong dollar and increasing rupee volatility.

  • Former RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das focused on stabilizing the rupee to attract foreign investments.
  • Critics argue that the fixed approach has weakened India’s export competitiveness.
  • Malhotra has not yet communicated his policy intentions, but signs suggest a shift towards allowing the rupee to fluctuate more.
  • Key economic advisors advocate for a more flexible exchange rate to improve competitiveness.
  • The rupee's real effective exchange rate indicates an overvaluation, requiring a depreciation of 2-3% to align with fundamentals.
“India’s external account has shifted from comfort to caution.” - Namrata Mittal, Chief Economist at SBI Mutual Fund

This article emphasizes the evolving challenges for the RBI in managing the rupee's value amidst global economic pressures, highlighting the need for potential policy changes.

item.title: SEBI ‘warning’ letter on social media to Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal: You have failed to … - The Times of India
item.description:
SEBI Cautions Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal Over Social Media Conduct

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Economic Times

In a recent communication, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has issued a warning letter to Ola's CEO, Bhavish Aggarwal, citing concerns over his activities on social media which may be in violation of securities laws.

  • The warning highlights specific posts made by Aggarwal that could mislead investors.
  • SEBI emphasizes the importance of transparency and ethical conduct in financial communications.
  • This comes amid increased scrutiny of leaders in the tech industry regarding their public statements.
"We expect all market participants to adhere strictly to disclosure norms and avoid any statements that could mislead stakeholders," stated a SEBI official.

This warning serves as a reminder of the regulatory obligations that CEOs have towards their public communications, especially in volatile markets.

item.title: Gold Rate Falls In India: Check 22 Carat Price In Your City On January 08 - News18
item.description:
Gold Rate Today In India: Check 22 Carat Price In Your City On January 08

Last Updated: January 08, 2025, 14:55 IST

Gold Rate Today In India: On January 08, 2025, gold prices in India held steady, reflecting current market trends. The 24-carat gold continued to attract buyers for its unmatched purity. In contrast, 22-carat gold remained the preferred choice for jewellery enthusiasts due to its durability and timeless elegance, making it an ideal option for long-term investments.

The price of 24-carat gold was Rs 78,700 for 10 grams, while 22-carat gold was Rs 72,140 for 10 grams. Silver was trading at Rs 91,400 per kilogram.

item.title: 'Sell Premier Energies, Waaree' shares advises this analyst, with a downside of up to 41% - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Sell Premier Energies, Waaree' shares advises this analyst, with a downside of up to 41%

Date: Jan 8, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

Kotak Institutional Equities has issued a 'sell' recommendation for the stocks of Premier Energies and Waaree Energies, forecasting significant potential downsides for both.

  • Kotak has set a price target of ₹770 for Premier Energies, suggesting a potential downside of 41% from current levels.
  • For Waaree Energies, the price target is ₹2,550, indicating an 8% downside.
  • Despite the downside projections, Premier Energies is expected to achieve a 44% CAGR from 2024 to 2030.
  • The solar sector in India is anticipated to grow at an 18% CAGR until 2030.
  • This is the first 'sell' rating for Premier Energies, coinciding with a 'hold' from JPMorgan.
“India's solar sector is primed for growth with a 18% CAGR in utility scale solar capacity additions until financial year 2030.”

The advisory indicates caution for investors in the renewable energy sectors defined by high valuations, with a potential for losses despite promising growth forecasts.

item.title: These Auto Stocks Are Jefferies Top Picks In 2025 Sector Outlook - NDTV Profit
item.description:
These Auto Stocks Are Jefferies' Top Picks In 2025 Sector Outlook

Date: 08 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The outlook for India's auto industry reveals growth divergence among key sectors, with two-wheelers and tractors expected to lead growth compared to passenger vehicles and trucks.

  • Jefferies forecasts a 13-15% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) for two-wheelers and tractors for FY25-27.
  • Passenger vehicles and trucks are projected at a CAGR of 5-8% during the same period.
  • Top picks include Mahindra and Mahindra, Eicher Motors, and TVS Motor, expected to outperform the market.
  • Mahindra's passenger vehicle market share is forecasted to increase, positioning it as a strong Hyundai competitor by FY27.
  • TVS Motor has seen its domestic two-wheeler market share rise to 17%.
  • Eicher Motors is projected to benefit from demand for premium motorcycles with a 16% earnings growth forecast.
  • Electric vehicle (EV) adoption is slow, with expectations of gradual growth in the two-wheeler segment's EV share.
“Jefferies remains positive on the Indian auto sector, with a focus on two-wheelers and tractors over passenger vehicles and trucks.”

Overall, the brokerage highlights opportunities in the two-wheeler and tractor markets while cautiously evaluating traditional segments.

item.title: Ola Electric shares in focus after SEBI warns of disclosure norm violations - The Economic Times
item.description:
Ola Electric Shares Drop 4% After Sebi Warning Over Disclosure Violations

Publication Date: January 8, 2024 Source: Economic Times

Ola Electric Mobility shares fell 3.8% after SEBI issued a warning for violating disclosure norms regarding the early announcement of a planned store network expansion. The Karnataka High Court also granted Ola an extension to respond to the CCPA.

  • Ola Electric shares dropped to Rs 76.12 on January 8, following an administrative warning from SEBI.
  • SEBI cited violations related to early announcements made by the company’s Chairman.
  • Ola Electric clarified that there are no financial implications from this warning.
  • The Karnataka High Court granted a six-week extension for Ola to respond to the CCPA's notice.
  • The average target price for Ola Electric shares is Rs 97, suggesting a potential upside of 22%.
"You are hereby warned and advised to be careful in the future and to improve your compliance standards." - SEBI

The incident highlights the importance of compliance with disclosure norms in the industry, and it remains to be seen how Ola Electric will navigate these challenges moving forward.

item.title: Tata Steel reports 6% YoY rise in crude steel production during Q3 FY25; check details, and how shares are performing - Upstox
item.description:
Tata Steel Reports 6% Yearly Growth in Crude Steel Production in Q3 FY25

Date: January 8, 2023 Source: PTI

Tata Steel has announced a year-on-year rise of 6% in crude steel production, reaching 5.68 million tonnes in Q3 FY25.

  1. Crude steel production increased from 5.35 million tonnes in Q3 FY24.
  2. Quarter-on-quarter, production saw an 8% increase.
  3. Steel deliveries in India rose by 8.4% year-on-year to 5.29 million tonnes.
  4. Tata Steel Netherlands reported liquid steel production of 1.76 million tonnes.
  5. UK operations saw a significant drop with output at zero due to blast furnace closures.
  6. CEO TV Narendran discussed challenges including China's pricing and global recovery issues.
“Despite challenges, Tata Steel is well-positioned and profitable in India due to growing demand.” - TV Narendran

The rise in production and deliveries indicates Tata Steel's robust position in the market despite global challenges.
